most_active_tickets.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to
VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension
Pieces extension for Obsidian using port 1000 but Pieces OS now listening port 39300
Cannot connect to Authentication site during install of Pieces
Cannot collapse all code block in Pieces Desktop

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance and Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage, sidebar display problems, and pro account access failures.  A temporary solution for performance issues is restarting PiecesOS.  Additional issues include code block collapse failures and Pieces OS upgrade difficulties from the Microsoft Store.  Users are encouraged to contact support for troubleshooting assistance.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Upgrade and Feature Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Pieces OS and Desktop App upgrades not reflecting in the software, including LLM versions and Pro features.  Issues involve discrepancies between selected settings and actual software behavior, primarily on Windows 11.  Troubleshooting steps like restarting, re-login, and VPN adjustments haven't resolved the problems.  Additionally, some users are encountering difficulties collapsing code blocks in the Pieces Desktop app.

related_issues.title: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to
related_issues.text: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Visual Studio, Sublime Plugin, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows 11 ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have a small problem now that cannot be solved through LLM: - I have inquired with LLM in **pieces for developers** and **pieces vscode plugin**, and they all said they are Sonnet 3.5. - The pieces LLM in sublime (set claude 3.7 sonnet) keeps silence about this: **Copilot**: I'm an AI assistant created by Anthropic named Claude, and my training data has a cutoff date. While I don't typically specify my exact version details, I can tell you that my knowledge cutoff is around late 2023. This means I don't have information about events, technologies, or developments that occurred after that time. However, - I just **upgraded to Pieces Pro yesterday** and have switched to Sonnet 4 (for all pieces IDE plugins and Desktop Apps, except for sublime which only support sonnet 3.7 till now). - Every test chat was opened in a new Chat after the LLM is switched( to Sonnet 4 or Gemini 2.5 Pro)... - I've checked the configuration files and they are all Sonnet 4 without any issues. - I have tried restarting my computer or logging in to my account again, but still have this bug - I have tried changing my computer and VPN node, including canceling or adding the global system proxy, but none of them worked PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. ## Pieces for Deveopers (desktop app) ## Vscode plugin ## Sublime plugin Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Integrations Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report multiple issues with Pieces integrations across desktop, VSCode, and web extensions. Problems include sidebar display errors, pro account features not activating despite login, inability to collapse code blocks in the desktop app, and continuous VScode extension installation requests despite the desktop app being installed.  Users have checked for existing issues and provided screenshots. Troubleshooting steps include verifying login status, checking Pieces OS version compatibility, and reinstalling extensions.

VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension. I have installed the extension from VSC, installed all the dependencies multiple times and never able to sign in, never able to launch Pieces from within VSC. I have the desktop running and installed and initialised every time, it makes no difference. I have even added the extension to web browsers and both work flawlessly. See screen shot below. common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection issues across desktop and plugins
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty connecting Pieces OS with desktop app and plugins like Obsidian. Issues include port detection failures, plugin functionality errors, and authentication problems during installation.  A common factor is Pieces OS version 12.2.1.  Suggested solutions include verifying network connectivity, checking firewall settings, and ensuring correct port configuration in plugin settings. Further investigation into Pieces OS and plugin compatibility is needed.

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Obsidian using port 1000 but Pieces OS now listening port 39300
related_issues.text:
Pieces extension for Obsidian using port 1000 but Pieces OS now listening port 39300
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Obsidian

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS Version: 12.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I installed Obsidian and added the Pieces extension. The chat works ok, but within Obsidian when I highlight text and right click to send to Pieces it fails. Checking inside Obsidian the Pieces setup it says Pieces port not detected, and does not allow me to set port for Pieces OS within Obsidian.

related_issues.title: Cannot connect to Authentication site during install of Pieces
related_issues.text:
Cannot connect to Authentication site during install of Pieces
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I end up at this url:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=917d9227-e6ca-45d6-ae1a-c6b76b70a5c1&platform=windows

Please note:  This is when I install Pieces as part of the UltraEdit 2025.0 install on my work VDI.
Our VDIs have Cortex XDR for security so this may be blocking it.  If so, I probably can't use Pieces at work.  I highly doubt they will open any ports for this.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop and OS Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting various issues with the Pieces desktop application and OS, including pixelated icons on macOS, inability to collapse code blocks on Windows, and sidebar issues related to error logging and pro settings not applying despite being logged in.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the PiecesOS performance issues (high RAM/CPU usage) as it affects multiple users and has a temporary workaround (restarting PiecesOS). Investigate the root cause and provide a permanent solution.

Address the Pieces OS and Desktop App upgrade issues to ensure users have access to the latest features and LLM versions. Focus on Windows 11 compatibility and investigate why settings don't reflect in the software behavior.

Investigate and resolve the Pieces integrations issues, particularly the sidebar display errors, pro account activation problems, and VScode extension installation issues. Ensure consistent functionality across desktop, VSCode, and web extensions.

Troubleshoot the Pieces OS connection problems with the desktop app and plugins like Obsidian. Focus on port detection, plugin functionality, and authentication during installation.  Check compatibility with Pieces OS version 12.2.1.
Address the UI/UX issues like the pixelated Mac icon and the inability to collapse code blocks in the desktop app to improve user experience.
